reviews.review_msg: Get ready for this course to wreck your gpa and pride. The TAs feel entirely useless but peter himself seems like an awesome guy. He allowed me to redo a paper my ta marked me POORLY on, that said ta set me up for failure for. This redo changed the letter grade overnight and I am in deep gratitude for dr Cramer. I have lots of stories.

For an English course there wasn't a whole lot of reading, which I was grateful for. Cramer is also just a really nice guy and super approachable. My TA for this class was also excellent. I found the assignments were a little complicated to understand but I'd take them any day over a final. There was no final, no midterm which was awesome.
Lectures are long, assignments can be so hard understand from the instructions.

Cramer is a nice guy, though his lecture is quite boring. Unfortunately, you must show up to his class to pass. The class is graded on 3 papers, the rubrics provided online are vague, and he briefly explains the structures of these papers in class. The SFU course page he uses barely works. AVOID.
